an5.49:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an5.49:4.2: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went up to the Buddha,
an5.49:4.3: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an5.49:5.2: Then a man went up to the king
an5.49:5.5: When this was said, King Pasenadi was miserable and sad. He sat with his shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.
an5.49:6.1: Knowing this, the Buddha said to him:
an5.49:6.2: “Great king, there are five things that cannot be had by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.
an5.49:6.4: That someone whose nature is to grow old should not grow old. … Sorrowing and crying don’t do even a little bit of good … ‘The karma is strong. What can I do now?’”
